snippet: Private equity investors agreed to buy Cirque du Soleil for 1.5 billion Canadian dollars, a purchase that will pave the way for the company to expand into China.
abstract: Group of private equity investors led by TPG agrees to buy Cirque du Soleil for 1.5 billion Canadian dollars with intention of expanding to Chinese market, as one of buyers is Fosun of China; circus has had difficulty breaking into China, as tastes in country diverge from what is popular in West.

byline.contributor: Brooks Barnes contributed reporting from Los Angeles and Michael Paulson from New York.

lead_paragraph: Private equity investors agreed to buy Cirque du Soleil for 1.5 billion Canadian dollars, a purchase that will pave the way for the company to expand into China.

headline.main: Sale of Cirque du Soleil Aims to Open Doors in China
headline.print_headline: Sale of Cirque du Soleil Aims to Open Doors in China
